STEPS:
1. get the 20020319 integration build 
2. create a new plugin project.
3. create a new feature project with name "ExampleFeature", and include the 
plugin
4. Open feature.xml for editing,  click on "create jar"

NOTICE:
an error occurs : "could not create feature jar:ExampleFeature"

NOTES:
looks like the PDE is looking for the feature.xml in this location:
  workspace\ExampleFeature\install\features\ExampleFeature\feature.xml 
but infact it has created this file in this locaton:
  workspace\ExampleFeature\install\features\ExampleFeature_1.0.0\feature.xml

I tested by following the same steps in the 20020321  integration build.  And 
there seems to be still a problem: 

I click on "create feature jar" , and PDE generates the build scripts, but it 
doesn't actually run them. 

When I right click on the build.xml for the feature, it gives me the following 
error:

"A problem occured executing the ant file:
Reason: can not find plugin: ExamplePlugin"
   where ExamplePlugin is name of the plugin included in the ExampleFeature.

As a workaround try setting the following property at the Ant wizard:
-Dplugin.path=file:c:/eclipse/runtime/20020321/workspace/

Where the value is a URL to the folder containing your workspace plugins 
(don't forget the trailing "/").

The pluginLocation task is now gone. All the plugin paths are expressed as 
file system paths relative to the feature build.xml .
Fixed for builds > 20020502.
